details.purpose: To record information about a single food item consumed by an individual.
details.use:
Use to record information about a single food item consumed by an individual.
Multiple instances of this archetype could be used to record each food consumed by an individual within a specified timeframe as part of a food diary.
This archetype may be extended using specific CLUSTER archetypes that represent further detail about the food item, such as CLUSTER.macronutrient or CLUSTER.micronutrient and other related archetypes.
details.misuse: Not to be used to record planned consumption of a food item.

items.items: Information about a single food item consumed by an individual.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
The name of the item of food being recorded.
The number of servings of food consumed.
Serving sizes should be defined in the Protocol section of this archetype.
A number that estimates how much the food will raise an individual'sÂ blood glucose levelÂ after eating it.
Details about the component nutrients for this food.
Additional narrative about the food item not captured in other fields.
Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
For example: Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.
Definition of the size of a single serving of the food item, by mass.
Definition of the size of a single serving of the food item, by volume.
The method used to measure the amount of food.
Details about the device used to measure or record the amount of the food item.
An approximation of the amount of the food item.
Actual measurement of the amount of the food item.
The amount of food was recorded from memory.
The amount of food was recorded at the time of consumption.
The qualitative precision of the amount of the food item.
One day interval event, which may be further defined in a template or at run-time, for example: specifically named as 'Friday' or 'Saturday'.
One week interval event, which may be further defined in a template or at run-time, for example: specifically named as 'Last week'.
